frame.label: Auto-resize filer windows

radio-group.name: filer_auto_resize
radio-group.radio: You'll have to resize windows manually, using the window manager, the `Resize Window' menu entry or by double-clicking on the window background.

radio.label: Resize when changing the display style

radio-group.radio: Changing the size of the icons or which details are displayed will resize the window for you.
The filer will resize windows whenever it seems useful (that is, when changing directory or display style).

frame.numentry: The largest size, as a percentage of the screen size, that the auto-resizer will resize a window to.

toggle.name: filer_change_size
toggle.label: Change from Large icons to Small automatically:

frame.toggle: If this is on then filer windows will change from Large icons to Small when showing a new directory with lots of files.
frame.numentry: If the directory contains this many items them it will be shown using Small Icons, otherwise Large Icons will be used.

frame.label: Window behaviour
frame.toggle: Use single letters instead of words for Scanning, All and Thumbs indicators in the titlebar.
If you open a directory and that directory is already displayed in another window, then this option causes the other window to be closed.

toggle.name: bind_new_button_1
toggle.label: New window on button 1 (RISC OS style)

frame.toggle: Clicking with mouse button 1 (usually the left button) opens a directory in a new window with this turned on. Clicking with the button-2 (middle) will reuse the current window.
Clicking on an item opens it with this on. Hold down Control to select the item instead. If off, clicking once selects an item; double click to open things.

frame.label: Sorting
frame.toggle: If off, does ASCII sort: File10, File9, file8. If on, ignores case and punctuation and handles numbers properly: file8, File9, File10
If this is on then directories will always appear before anything else, regardless of the sort type.

frame.label: Icon text width
frame.numentry: Text wider than this is broken onto two lines in Large Icons mode. In Huge Icons mode, text is wrapped when 50% wider than this.
Maximum width for the text beside a Small Icon.

frame.label: Default settings for new windows
frame.toggle: If this is on then display options for a new window are inherited from the source window if possible, otherwise they are set to the defaults below.

vbox.toggle: If this is on then files whose names start with a dot are shown too, otherwise they are hidden.
Load every image file and display it, scaled-down, in the filer window instead of the normal icon.

hbox.toggle: Show the number of items displayed in a filer window, as well as the number of hidden items (if any). When there's a selection, show the number of selected items and their combined size.

section.title: Minibuffers
section.label: The minibuffers are text entry fields that appear along the bottom of a filer window. They are used to enter pathnames, search conditions and shell commands.

frame.label: Beeping
frame.toggle: When using the `Enter Path...' minibuffer and Tab is pressed, beep if nothing happens (eg, because there are several possibilities and the next letter varies).

toggle.name: filer_beep_multi
toggle.label: Beep if there are several matches

frame.toggle: When using the `Enter Path...' minibuffer and Tab is pressed, beep if there is more than one matching file, even though some more letters were added.

section.title: Pinboard
section.label: When using a pinboard, you can drag files and applications onto the desktop background to create shortcuts to them.

frame.label: Pinboard behaviour
frame.toggle: Clicking on an item opens it with this on. Hold down Control to select the item instead. If off, clicking once selects an item; double click to open things.

toggle.name: pinboard_forward_button_3
toggle.label: Pass button-3 clicks to window manager

frame.toggle: Normally, clicking on the desktop background will open the pinboard menu. Turn this on to forward the event to your window manager instead. Clicks on icons will not be forwarded.
If this is set, pinboard icons are always kept completely within screen limits, including the label.

radio-group.name: pinboard_grid_step
radio-group.radio: Use a 2-pixel grid for positioning icons on the desktop.
Use a 16-pixel grid for positioning icons on the desktop.
Use a 32-pixel grid for positioning icons on the desktop.

frame.label: Iconfied windows
frame.toggle: Most window managers provide a way to iconify (or 'minimise') windows, and various programs, including ROX-Filer, can be used to display the iconified windows. If this option is on, the filer will show each iconified window as a small button on the screen. Requires a compatible window manager.

section.title: Panels
section.label: Panels are bars of icons that run along the side of the screen. See the manual for information about using panels.

radio-group.name: panel_style
radio-group.radio: Every panel icon is shown with an image and some text.
Applications have just an image, everything else has both an image and text.

section.title: Action windows
section.label: Action windows appear when you start a background operation, such as copying or deleting some files.

frame.label: Auto-start (Quiet) these actions
frame.toggle: Copy files without confirming first.
Move files without confirming first.
Create links to files without confirming first.
Delete files without confirming first.
Mount and unmount filesystems without confirming first.

hbox.toggle: Don't confirm deletion of non-writeable items.
Don't display so much information in the message area.
Only over-write if source is newer than destination.

frame.label: General
frame.toggle: Some older applications don't support XDND fully and may need to have this option turned on. Use this if dragging files to an application shows a + sign on the pointer but the drop doesn't work.

toggle.name: dnd_drag_to_icons
toggle.label: Allow dragging to icons in filer windows

frame.toggle: When this is on you can drag a file over a sub-directory or program in a filer window. The item will highlight when you do this and dropping the file will put it into that directory, or load it into the program.
This option, which requires the above option to be turned on too, causes the highlighted directory to 'spring open' after the file is held over it for a short while.
frame.numentry: This option sets how long, in ms, you must hold a file over a directory before it will spring open. The above option must be turned on for this to have any effect.

frame.label: Dragging files with the middle mouse button

radio-group.name: dnd_middle_menu

radio.label: Shows a menu of possible actions

radio-group.radio: Note that you can still get the menu to appear, by dragging with the left button and holding down the Alt key

frame.label: General
frame.toggle: Use button 2, the middle button (click both buttons at once on two button mice), to pop up the menu. If off, use button 3 (right) instead.

frame.label: `Xterm Here' program
frame.entry: The program to launch when you choose `Xterm Here' from the menu.

frame.label: General

toggle.name: display_ignore_exec
toggle.label: Ignore eXecutable bit for known extensions

frame.toggle: If a file has a known extension (eg '.gif') then ignore the executable bit. This is useful if you have files on a Windows-type filesystem which are being shown as executable programs.

frame.label: MIME types

The filer uses a set of rules to work out the correct MIME type for each regular file, and then chooses a suitable icon for that type. After editing the files, click the re-read button below, or restart the filer.
Use the 'Set Icon...' dialog box to set the icon for each MIME type.
File type colours

toggle.name: display_colour_types
toggle.label: Colour files based on their types

frame.toggle: Filenames (and details) are coloured according to the file's type.

vbox.colour: Error, such as a symlink which points to a non-existant file, or a file which the filer does not have permission to examine.
